decks.notes: The deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Ocelot Pride, backed up by burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment. It also leverages powerful planeswalkers like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah to control the board and push for damage. Supporting cards like Static Prison and Thraben Charm help disrupt the opponent's game plan, while cards like Seasoned Pyromancer and Ranger-Captain of Eos provide card advantage and search for key pieces. Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Arena of Glory offer additional threats and ways to close out the game.

The deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures and burn spells to quickly reduce the opponent's life total. It includes powerful Boros cards like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah, along with efficient removal like Lightning Bolt and Solitude. The deck also includes ways to generate tokens and get additional value from sacrificing creatures, such as Goblin Bombardment. With a mix of threats, removal, and disruption, the Boros Aggro deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and win the game before they can stabilize.

This deck focuses on aggressive plays with a mix of powerful creatures and efficient removal spells. It aims to quickly pressure opponents with creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Scion of Draco, while using Leyline of the Guildpact to boost their effectiveness. Lightning Bolt and Tribal Flames provide extra reach and removal, while Leyline Binding and Stubborn Denial help protect key creatures. Consign to Memory and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker provide additional options for disruption and card advantage. The mana base is designed to support a wide range of colors for maximum flexibility in casting spells.

The main focus of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan through a combination of countermagic, removal spells, and hand disruption. By using cards like Thoughtseize, Spell Snare, and Force of Negation, the deck aims to prevent the opponent from executing their strategy effectively. Murktide Regent and Psychic Frog provide threats that can close out the game once the opponent's resources have been depleted. The deck also features card draw options like Consider and Thought Scour to help find key pieces to control the game.

This deck focuses on aggressive creatures and powerful spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It combines a mix of different colors for maximum versatility and offers a mix of efficient creature threats and burn spells to control the board and finish off the opponent quickly. The inclusion of Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding helps to boost the power of your creatures, while cards like Lightning Bolt and Stubborn Denial provide direct removal and protection. Overall, this deck aims to be fast and aggressive, putting pressure on the opponent from the start.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the synergy between creatures like Glaring Fleshraker and Basking Broodscale, along with equipment like Blade of the Bloodchief, to generate value and create a powerful board presence. The deck also includes cards like Kozilek's Command and Malevolent Rumble to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The use of Urza's Saga and other mana ramp cards allows for quick deployment of threats, while cards like Ancient Stirrings and Traverse the Ulvenwald can help find key pieces of the combo.

This deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End. It also utilizes cards like Ancient Stirrings and Urza's Saga to search for key combo pieces such as Blade of the Bloodchief and Malevolent Rumble. The combination of Basking Broodscale and Glaring Fleshraker allows for potent creature synergies while cards like Agatha's Soul Cauldron and Kozilek's Command provide disruption and removal options. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of efficient creatures, powerful spells, and strong combo interactions.

This deck focuses on utilizing a combination of artifacts and legendary creatures to generate value and control the game. By recurring key artifacts with cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Kethis, the Hidden Hand, and using planeswalkers like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to generate card advantage, the deck aims to create a powerful engine that can grind out opponents. Additionally, the deck includes disruptive elements like Teferi, Time Raveler to slow down opponents and protect its combo pieces. Overall, the strategy revolves around generating incremental advantages and overwhelming opponents with a well-oiled machine.

This deck focuses on utilizing Jeskai Ascendancy along with various artifacts and creatures to create a combo that generates infinite mana and draws cards. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Mishra's Bauble are key pieces in recurring artifacts from the graveyard, while Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student helps dig for combo pieces. Narset, Jeskai Waymaster provides additional card advantage, and Metallic Rebuke offers disruption against the opponent's spells. The goal is to assemble the combo pieces quickly and win the game through a powerful engine of card draw and mana generation.

The main concept of this deck is to efficiently tutor for and play out a variety of creatures to create a powerful board state. By using cards like Chord of Calling and Birthing Ritual, the deck can quickly assemble combos and toolbox creatures like Cauldron Familiar and Yawgmoth, Thran Physician. The deck also includes protection and utility cards like Boseiju, Who Endures and Viscera Seer to help ensure the combo pieces can come together smoothly. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Fatal Push and Wall of Roots for removal and mana acceleration.

This deck focuses on quickly reanimating powerful creatures like Griselbrand using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Tainted Indulgence. It also utilizes instant spells like Solitude and Prismatic Ending for removal and protection. The deck includes cards like Psychic Frog for card advantage and disruptive creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier. It also has graveyard recursion with cards like Ephemerate and Late to Dinner to consistently bring back key pieces. The goal is to set up a powerful board state quickly and overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and disruptive plays.

The deck focuses on quickly reanimating powerful creatures from the graveyard using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate. This allows the player to surprise their opponent with big threats like Griselbrand or Emperor of Bones. The deck also includes disruption like Thoughtseize and Force of Negation to protect the combo. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Solitude and Tainted Indulgence provide additional control options. The deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and disruptive spells.

This Jeskai Control deck focuses on using a mixture of removal spells, card draw, and powerful creatures to control the game and outvalue the opponent. By disrupting their game plan with cards like Dress Down and Tune the Narrative, while generating card advantage with Nulldrifter and Consign to Memory, the deck aims to stabilize the board and overwhelm the opponent with threats like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury. The inclusion of counter spells like Force of Negation and Wrath of the Skies helps to protect your own board and disrupt the opponent's strategy, giving you the upper hand in the match.

This aggro deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push, while also utilizing creatures with powerful abilities such as Ephemerate and Flickerwisp to gain advantage on the battlefield. By combining aggressive creatures like Emperor of Bones and Overlord of the Balemurk with disruptive elements like Witch Enchanter and Solitude, this deck aims to pressure the opponent while controlling the board. With a mix of removal, card advantage, and strong creatures, this Death And Taxes deck aims to outmaneuver and outvalue its opponent in a Modern 1 vs 1 match.

The main concept of this UR Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and efficient creatures and spells. The deck focuses on playing low-cost creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Slickshot Show-Off, while also utilizing powerful spells like Lightning Bolt and Mutagenic Growth to deal damage quickly. The deck also includes cards like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Cori-Steel Cutter to provide additional aggression and disruption. By combining efficient creatures with burn spells and card draw, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early and close out the game before they can stabilize.

The main theme of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy through a combination of countermagic, removal spells, and hand disruption. The deck focuses on controlling the game by countering key spells, removing threats from the board, and disrupting the opponent's hand size. With cards like Thought Scour and Unearth to fill the graveyard, the deck also has access to powerful creatures like Murktide Regent. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to maintain control over the game while slowly grinding out advantage and ultimately winning through attrition.
